programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, he stays on to help and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: Fort Dobbs
programme.desc: A wanted man (Clint Walker) leads a widow (Virginia Mayo) and her son to a fort away from Indians and a gunrunner (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Dakota
programme.desc: A woman and her daughter find warmth and companionship when her late husband's combat dog comes to live on their farm. However, they must soon band together when a corrupt sheriff does whatever it takes to get his hands on the family's land.

programme.title: The Moonlighter
programme.desc: A cattle herder/rustler (Fred MacMurray) escapes from a lynch mob but surrenders to his ex-girlfriend (Barbara Stanwyck).

programme.title: Cole Younger, Gunfighter
programme.desc: A notorious outlaw (Frank Lovejoy) helps a cowboy (James Best) fight political corruption in 1873 Texas.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco uses an iron mask to bring a notorious gang to justice.

programme.title: The Tin Star
programme.desc: An ex-lawman bounty hunter (Henry Fonda) shows a tenderfoot sheriff (Anthony Perkins) how to tame a town.

programme.title: Gentle Annie
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Craig) befriends two train robbers, their mother (Marjorie Main) and a stranded waitress (Donna Reed) in 1901 Oklahoma.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A former deputy and his gang terrorize a town with the help of a corrupt sheriff.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate the kidnapping of banker Penrose from a stagecoach; they immediately suspect noted bandit Milt Sharp who recently escaped from a Nevada prison and his partner Dutch; a showdown takes place at the Penrose home.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate when a railroad payroll worth $25,000 is stolen.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret head to Denver in the late 1860's after the killing of a railroad telegraph operator; bail jumper L H Musgrove, a known horse thief is their chief suspect; Musgrove and his pal end up facing vigilante justice.

programme.title: Broken Arrow
programme.desc: A lone frontiersman (James Stewart) risks his life to forge peace between Arizona settlers and Cochise's (Jeff Chandler) Apache nation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former POW imprisons Lucas for his role in the Civil War.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A traveling salesman is accused of forcing his attentions on a local woman.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Madame Francine's cousin gets kidnapped.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: The New Orleans underworld conspires to rub out administrator Colton.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A gun-happy youth and a restless woman haunt a reformed gunman.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A bounty hunter pursues a couple who have eloped.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A bully comes to his senses.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A man fears being forced to kill.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A woman confronts thugs while maintaining her father's business.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theatre
programme.desc: A condemned man escapes hanging to find the liar who doomed him.

programme.title: Arizona Bushwhackers
programme.desc: The Union army sends a Confederate prisoner (Howard Keel) to Arizona as a lawman, but he doubles as a spy.
